Username: Hany Elnaggar, CA, M.Sc Ù‡Ø§Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¬Ø§Ø±Hany Elnaggar, CA, M.Sc Ù‡Ø§Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¬Ø§Ø±
Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

The ideal candidate should have strong proficiency in Java back end development as well as hands-on experience with modern front-end technologies. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable web applications end-to-end.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain scalable web applications using Java (Spring Boot) on the backend and modern JavaScript frameworks on the frontend (React, Angular, or Vue.js).Collaborate with UI/UX designers, backend engineers, and product managers to implement features and enhance application performance.Design and develop RESTful APIs and integrate third-party services.Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices.Participate in code reviews, unit testing, and performance tuning.Troubleshoot and debug production issues and implement effective solutions.Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve development practices.Required Skills & Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.[X+] years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.Strong expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and RESTful API development.Proficiency in front-end technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and frameworks like React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB).Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps tools is a plus.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or as part of a team.Whose looking for the change or anyone have a reference please share at tahir@mindtelglobal.comhashtag#javafullstack hashtag#angular hashtag#Springboot hashtag#Dubaijob hashtag#immediate

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:â€¢ Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.â€¢ Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.â€¢ Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.â€¢ Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFEâ€¢ Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMHâ€¢ Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.â€¢ Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.â€¢ Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partnersâ€™ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnershipâ€™s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: â€¢	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: â€¢	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants
